Tangent to a circle

  1. If there are two points of intersection between a line and the circle, we call the line a secant of the circle.
  2. A tangent to a circle is a line that intersects the circle at only one point.
  3. It is possible to draw only one tangent at a point of the circle
  4. The common point of the tangent and the circle is called the point of contact
  5. The tangent at any point of a circle is perpendicular to the radius through the point of contact.
  6. The line containing the radius through the point of contact is also sometimes called the 'normal' to the circle at the point.
